entries.title: Hello, World!
entries.subtitle: A child is born
entries.description: I was born and raised in the suburbs of Stockholm, Sweden.

entries.title: Life is good!
entries.subtitle: Video games, computers and heavy metal
entries.description: I spent my time playing video games, fiddling with computers and soon enough listening to heavy metal.

entries.title: Curious beginnings
entries.subtitle: Learned Ruby, senior high school
entries.description: On my 18th birthday my dad bought me a book called 'Learn to Program' by Chris Pine. I wished to explore the world of programming, curious if it was something I would enjoy. It sure was!

entries.title: To a certain degree...
entries.subtitle: BA in computer science, Stockholm University
entries.description: After senior high school I kept on developing (hah!) my skills. I spent two years studying, worked for one year and then resumed and finished my BA degree in computer science.

entries.title: Have you tried turning it off and on again?
entries.subtitle: IT Support, Viktor Rydberg Djursholm
entries.description: In between my second and third year at Stockholm Univerity I worked at my old junior high school as an IT Support. I gained some experience in managing stressful situations as well as "Imaginative ways you can damage a computer". Here's a tip, milkshakes and computers do not go together...

entries.title: I want it all!
entries.subtitle: Developer and Project Manager, Sweco
entries.description: My whole experience can be described as being invited to Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory. I could try every flavour of software development: frontend, backend, databases, operations, project management and many more.

entries.title: Qoute from my manager at Sweco
entries.description: "Carl is driven, methodical, maintains high quality in all his commitments and has acted very professionally in all his assignments."

entries.title: Taking on padawans of my own
entries.subtitle: Senior Developer, Digitalent
entries.description: This is where I really got to enhance my coaching skills. I mentored four junior developers in total and watched as they grew from padawans to Jedi masters (I'm such a nerd).

entries.title: Qoute from my client
entries.description: "Carl is an incredible bringer of joy who could create a nice atmosphere at a funeral... In a good way."
